alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 8:39AM EST until January 16 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Northampton and Halifax Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Monday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 12.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 10/13/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 15.9 Mon 8 am EST 14.6 13.7 13.0 12.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 845 PM EST.
